channel.title: üè¢ University of Cambridge on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ University of Cambridge on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: A Generative Model of Symmetry Transformations
item.description: Generative model learns data symmetries for improved efficiency and higher test log-likelihoods.

item.title: A theoretical design of concept sets: improving the predictability of concept bottleneck models
item.description: Boosting concept bottleneck model predictability, this paper introduces a theoretical framework linking concept set properties to model performance, proposing a method for effective concept identifica…

item.title: Accelerating Relative Entropy Coding with Space Partitioning
item.description: Space partitioning dramatically speeds up relative entropy coding (REC) for neural compression, achieving 5-15% better bitrates than previous methods.

item.title: An Improved Empirical Fisher Approximation for Natural Gradient Descent
item.description: Improved Empirical Fisher (iEF) approximation significantly boosts the performance of Natural Gradient Descent (NGD) optimizers, offering superior convergence and generalization.

item.title: Approximately Equivariant Neural Processes
item.description: Boosting meta-learning, this paper introduces a novel, flexible approach to create approximately equivariant neural processes that outperform both non-equivariant and strictly equivariant counterparts…

item.title: Automatically Learning Hybrid Digital Twins of Dynamical Systems
item.description: AI autonomously designs highly effective hybrid digital twins by combining neural networks and mechanistic models, significantly advancing digital twin technology.

item.title: Bias in Motion: Theoretical Insights into the Dynamics of Bias in SGD Training
item.description: AI systems acquire bias during training, impacting accuracy across sub-populations. This research unveils bias’s dynamic nature, revealing how classifier preferences shift over time, influenced by dat…

item.title: Constructing Semantics-Aware Adversarial Examples with Probabilistic Perspective
item.description: Researchers developed semantics-aware adversarial examples using a probabilistic approach, achieving higher success rates in bypassing defenses while remaining undetectable to humans.

item.title: Context-Aware Testing: A New Paradigm for Model Testing with Large Language Models
item.description: Context-Aware Testing (CAT) revolutionizes ML model testing by using contextual information to identify relevant failures, surpassing traditional data-only methods.

item.title: Data-Driven Discovery of Dynamical Systems in Pharmacology using Large Language Models
item.description: LLMs iteratively discover and refine interpretable dynamical systems models, achieving high accuracy and uncovering new insights; demonstrated by a novel Warfarin model.

item.title: Deep Equilibrium Algorithmic Reasoning
item.description: Deep Equilibrium Algorithmic Reasoners (DEARs) achieve superior performance on algorithmic tasks by directly solving for the equilibrium point of a neural network, eliminating the need for iterative r…

item.title: Fearless Stochasticity in Expectation Propagation
item.description: This paper introduces EP-Œ∑ and EP-Œº, novel EP variants remarkably robust to Monte Carlo noise, achieving improved speed and accuracy.

item.title: Generating Origin-Destination Matrices in Neural Spatial Interaction Models
item.description: GeNSIT: a neural framework efficiently generates origin-destination matrices for agent-based models, outperforming existing methods in accuracy and scalability by directly operating on the discrete sp…

item.title: On conditional diffusion models for PDE simulations
item.description: This paper introduces novel autoregressive sampling and hybrid training strategies for score-based diffusion models, significantly boosting PDE forecasting and assimilation accuracy.

item.title: Predicting Future Actions of Reinforcement Learning Agents
item.description: Predicting RL agent behavior is key for safety and interaction; this study reveals that explicitly planned agents are significantly easier to predict due to their internal plans.

item.title: Predicting Ground State Properties: Constant Sample Complexity and Deep Learning Algorithms
item.description: Deep learning algorithms now predict quantum ground state properties with constant sample complexity, regardless of system size, improving upon previous methods.

item.title: Recurrent neural network dynamical systems for biological vision
item.description: CordsNet: a hybrid CNN-RNN architecture enabling biologically realistic, robust image recognition through continuous-time recurrent dynamics.

item.title: Rule Extrapolation in Language Modeling: A Study of Compositional Generalization on OOD Prompts
item.description: LLMs struggle with out-of-distribution (OOD) generalization. This research introduces ‘rule extrapolation’ using formal languages to rigorously evaluate OOD behavior in various LLM architectures, rev…

item.title: Second-order forward-mode optimization of recurrent neural networks for neuroscience
item.description: SOFO: a novel second-order optimizer enables efficient and memory-friendly RNN training for neuroscience tasks, surpassing Adam’s performance, especially on long time horizons.

item.title: Self-Healing Machine Learning: A Framework for Autonomous Adaptation in Real-World Environments
item.description: Self-healing machine learning (SHML) autonomously diagnoses and fixes model performance degradation caused by data shifts, outperforming reason-agnostic methods.

item.title: TinyTTA: Efficient Test-time Adaptation via Early-exit Ensembles on Edge Devices
item.description: TinyTTA enables efficient test-time adaptation on memory-constrained edge devices using a novel self-ensemble and early-exit strategy, improving accuracy and reducing memory usage.

item.title: Zero-Shot Tokenizer Transfer
item.description: Zero-Shot Tokenizer Transfer (ZeTT) detaches language models from their tokenizers via a hypernetwork, enabling efficient on-the-fly tokenizer swapping without retraining, significantly improving LLM …
